title.narrative: SUSTAINABLE WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: Annualy, at least 1.4 million most vulnerable population in emergency affected and underserved areas have equitable, sustainable and gender sensitive access to new and rehabilitated improved drinking water sources., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Health â€“ General, Nutrition â€“ General, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 3.8 million of the most vulnerable children (girls and boys) including children affected by humanitarian crisis have access and use scaled-up proven sustainable, high impact, integrated quality services for life saving, learning, development and protection in the most deprived localities in Sudan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Annualy, at least 1.4 million most vulnerable population in emergency affected and underserved areas have equitable,sustainable and gender sensitive access to new and rehabilitated improved drinking water sources.

description.narrative: 2.9 million vulnerable people (208% of 1.4 million targeted people) affected by conflict, AWD and in rural underserved areas gained access to gender sensitive improved water sources through construction/rehabilitation of improved water sources, operation and maintenance and disinfection at point of collection, transport and in households. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018
